{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, SME Unit",
  "description": "LEAD Enterprise Support Company Limited is a foremost Human Resources Solutions organization with many years of cumulative experience and expertise. We are prolific in Outsourcing, Recruitment, Head hunting and HR Advisory. We are a multi-sectorial servicing company, with landmark service deliverables to our clients in varied industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, SME Unit
Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	Lead and manage SME Unit, driving growth, ensuring efficient delivery of SME products, maintaining portfolio quality, and managing operational activities in line with regulatory and internal standards.


Key Responsibilities:


	Oversee SME operations, including account onboarding, loans, repayments, and portfolio monitoring.
	Ensure compliance with CBN regulations, internal policies, and AML/KYC requirements.
	Drive SME client acquisition, retention, and business support initiatives.
	Review and improve SME workflows, processes, and digital solutions.
	Prepare performance and portfolio reports, supporting audits and management reviews.
	Lead, mentor, and manage SME staff while collaborating with Operations, Risk, Finance, and IT teams.


Requirements:


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Banking &amp; Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field (MBA preferred).
	8 - 12 years in banking / microfinance with 3 - 5 years in a managerial role.
	Strong knowledge of SME lending, portfolio management, and microfinance operations.
	Leadership, risk management, and client relationship skills.
	Experience with core banking systems and regulatory compliance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;recruitment@leadhradvisory.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Head, SME Unit Job at LEAD Enterprise Support Company Limited




        
    

        
        LEAD Enterprise Support Company Limited is a foremost Human Resources Solutions organization with many years of cumulative experience and expertise. We are prolific in Outsourcing, Recruitment, Head hunting and HR Advisory. We are a multi-sectorial servicing company, with landmark service deliverables to our clients in varied industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, SME Unit
Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	Lead and manage SME Unit, driving growth, ensuring efficient delivery of SME products, maintaining portfolio quality, and managing operational activities in line with regulatory and internal standards.


Key Responsibilities:


	Oversee SME operations, including account onboarding, loans, repayments, and portfolio monitoring.
	Ensure compliance with CBN regulations, internal policies, and AML/KYC requirements.
	Drive SME client acquisition, retention, and business support initiatives.
	Review and improve SME workflows, processes, and digital solutions.
	Prepare performance and portfolio reports, supporting audits and management reviews.
	Lead, mentor, and manage SME staff while collaborating with Operations, Risk, Finance, and IT teams.


Requirements:


	Bachelor's Degree in Banking & Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field (MBA preferred).
	8 - 12 years in banking / microfinance with 3 - 5 years in a managerial role.
	Strong knowledge of SME lending, portfolio management, and microfinance operations.
	Leadership, risk management, and client relationship skills.
	Experience with core banking systems and regulatory compliance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@leadhradvisory.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Videographer & Creative Video Editor",
  "description": "Media Style Concept (MSC) is a dynamic media and event production company committed to delivering creative, high-impact media content and event experiences. We pride ourselves on innovation, excellence, and professionalism.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer &amp; Creative Video Editor

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Are you a talented and creative Videographer with a passion for storytelling through video?
	Do you excel in bringing concepts to life through high-quality filming and seamless editing?
	If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
	This role offers an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, creative environment, capturing and editing stunning visual content for a range of events, corporate projects, and media productions.


Key Responsibilities


	Collaborate with the creative team to conceptualize, shoot, and edit high-quality video content for various multimedia projects, including events, commercials, corporate videos, and digital campaigns.
	Capture dynamic footage at live events, ensuring the best moments are recorded with creativity and precision.
	Edit raw footage into polished videos, incorporating sound, graphics, and special effects to create visually engaging content.
	Ensure that all video content aligns with the company&rsquo;s brand identity and meets project requirements.
	Work closely with clients to understand their vision and deliver compelling visual stories.
	Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in video production and editing.
	Manage and maintain video equipment, ensuring its functionality and readiness for shoots.


Requirements


	Degree or Certification in Film Production, Multimedia, Communication Arts, or any other field.
	3 - 4 years of professional experience in videography and video editing.
	Familiarity with social media platforms and creating content tailored for platforms such as Instagram, YouTube, and Facebook is advantageous.
	Ability to work flexibly, including weekends and evenings for event coverage, as required.


Qualifications and Skills:


	Proven experience as a Videographer and Video Editor, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous work.
	Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, After Effects, or other relevant tools.
	Strong knowledge of camera operation, lighting, sound recording, and other aspects of video production.
	Creative flair and an eye for detail in capturing visually appealing shots and editing them into compelling narratives.
	Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
	Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to take direction and offer creative input.
	A good understanding of color grading, motion graphics, and special effects is an added advantage.
	Experience working in the event or multimedia industry is a plus.


Salary
&nbsp;N150,000 - N250,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;mediastylecompany@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Videographer &amp; Creative Video Editor Application&rsquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-12",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Media Style Concept"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

}



Videographer & Creative Video Editor Job at Media Style Concept




        
    

        
        Media Style Concept (MSC) is a dynamic media and event production company committed to delivering creative, high-impact media content and event experiences. We pride ourselves on innovation, excellence, and professionalism.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Videographer & Creative Video Editor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Are you a talented and creative Videographer with a passion for storytelling through video?
	Do you excel in bringing concepts to life through high-quality filming and seamless editing?
	If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
	This role offers an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, creative environment, capturing and editing stunning visual content for a range of events, corporate projects, and media productions.


Key Responsibilities


	Collaborate with the creative team to conceptualize, shoot, and edit high-quality video content for various multimedia projects, including events, commercials, corporate videos, and digital campaigns.
	Capture dynamic footage at live events, ensuring the best moments are recorded with creativity and precision.
	Edit raw footage into polished videos, incorporating sound, graphics, and special effects to create visually engaging content.
	Ensure that all video content aligns with the company’s brand identity and meets project requirements.
	Work closely with clients to understand their vision and deliver compelling visual stories.
	Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in video production and editing.
	Manage and maintain video equipment, ensuring its functionality and readiness for shoots.


Requirements


	Degree or Certification in Film Production, Multimedia, Communication Arts, or any other field.
	3 - 4 years of professional experience in videography and video editing.
	Familiarity with social media platforms and creating content tailored for platforms such as Instagram, YouTube, and Facebook is advantageous.
	Ability to work flexibly, including weekends and evenings for event coverage, as required.


Qualifications and Skills:


	Proven experience as a Videographer and Video Editor, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous work.
	Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, After Effects, or other relevant tools.
	Strong knowledge of camera operation, lighting, sound recording, and other aspects of video production.
	Creative flair and an eye for detail in capturing visually appealing shots and editing them into compelling narratives.
	Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
	Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to take direction and offer creative input.
	A good understanding of color grading, motion graphics, and special effects is an added advantage.
	Experience working in the event or multimedia industry is a plus.


Salary
 N150,000 - N250,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mediastylecompany@gmail.com using "Videographer & Creative Video Editor Application’ as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Secretary",
  "description": "At Workforce Group, we go beyond narrowly defined client issues, beyond conventional wisdom, beyond the expected, to create opportunities for our clients, candidates, colleagues, collaborators, and community. Through a network of diversified but highly complementary lines of businesses we have helped some of the most important and exciting organisations on the continent find the critical talent, access cutting edge advice and get innovative support they require to grow in a challenging market.

We support businesses and organisations of varying size, structure and maturity across diverse sectors such as Technology, Telecoms, Oil &amp; Gas, Financial Services, Third Sector, FMCG, etc. to enhance business performance, optimise for growth and achieve exceptional results.

Secretary Job at Workforce Group




        
    

        
        At Workforce Group, we go beyond narrowly defined client issues, beyond conventional wisdom, beyond the expected, to create opportunities for our clients, candidates, colleagues, collaborators, and community. Through a network of diversified but highly complementary lines of businesses we have helped some of the most important and exciting organisations on the continent find the critical talent, access cutting edge advice and get innovative support they require to grow in a challenging market.

We support businesses and organisations of varying size, structure and maturity across diverse sectors such as Technology, Telecoms, Oil & Gas, Financial Services, Third Sector, FMCG, etc. to enhance business performance, optimise for growth and achieve exceptional results.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary
Job Location: Victoria Island and Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Job Industry: Banking

Requirement


	HND (Upper credit).


Benefits


	Salary: N208,000 / month Plus HMO and Pension.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Multimedia Creative Designer (Graphic Design & Video)",
  "description": "Snapnet&nbsp;&nbsp;Limited is&nbsp;a leading technology consulting firm and certified partner of Microsoft, AWS, Oracle, Huawei, and other global OEMs.Snapnet is an ICT Consulting firm with strategic focus in developing Industry specific solutions, Business consulting and Systems Integration with offices in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria. We are committed to delivering first class innovation, quality, and state of the art technology solutions to discerning clients both in the private and public sector.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Multimedia Creative Designer (Graphic Design &amp; Video)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	We are seeking a highly creative and execution-focused Multimedia Creative Designer who will own the visual identity, graphic assets, and video content across all our digital and physical marketing channels.
	This role is critical to driving brand visibility, lead generation, product storytelling, and sales enablement across Snapnet and its SaaS products (HCMatrix, Acumeet, Procurecentro).
	You will work closely with Digital Marketing, Content, Sales, Product, and Leadership to translate ideas, campaigns, and product features into high-impact visual and video assets.


Key Responsibilities
Graphic Design (Core Responsibility):


	Design high-quality visual assets for:
	Social media (LinkedIn, Instagram, X)
	Websites &amp; landing pages
	Email marketing campaigns
	Blog posts, whitepapers, ebooks, and case studies
	Sales decks, proposals, pitch decks, and brochures
	Event materials (banners, roll-ups, flyers, stage visuals)
	Maintain and enforce brand consistency across all designs.
	Collaborate with the content team to visually interpret written content.
	Design creatives optimized for lead generation and conversions.
	Create infographics to simplify complex technology concepts (AI, Data, HR, SaaS).


Video Production &amp; Editing:


	Plan, shoot, and edit videos including:
	Product demos &amp; walkthroughs
	Explainer videos
	Short-form social videos (LinkedIn reels, teasers, clips)
	Founder/Executive thought leadership videos
	Event highlights, customer testimonials, interviews
	Edit raw footage into engaging, platform-optimized videos.
	Add motion graphics, subtitles, overlays, intros/outros.
	Optimize videos for performance across digital platforms.


Campaign &amp; Content Support:


	Support marketing campaigns with creative assets aligned to campaign goals.
	Translate GTM themes, messaging, and value propositions into visuals.
	Work closely with:
	Digital Marketer &rarr; performance &amp; campaign creatives
	Content Manager &rarr; blogs, ebooks, long-form content
	Sales Team &rarr; presentations, proposal visuals
	Participate in campaign planning sessions to ideate creative angles.


Brand &amp; Visual Asset Management:


	Build and maintain a central brand asset library.
	Manage templates for recurring assets (social posts, decks, reports).
	Ensure quick turnaround times without sacrificing quality.
	Continuously improve the brand&rsquo;s visual identity.


Innovation &amp; Creative Direction:


	Stay up to date with:
	Design trends
	Video formats
	Social media creative best practices
	Proactively suggest new creative formats and content ideas.
	Experiment with AI-assisted design and video tools where appropriate.


Required Skills &amp; Experience
Technical Skills:


	Strong proficiency in:
	Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
	Video editing tools (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut, CapCut, DaVinci Resolve)
	Solid understanding of:
	Typography
	Layout design
	Color theory
	Motion graphics basics
	Experience creating content for B2B and SaaS brands is a major advantage.


Creative &amp; Soft Skills:


	Strong visual storytelling ability.
	Ability to convert abstract ideas into clear visuals.
	Excellent attention to detail.
	Ability to work under tight deadlines in a startup environment.
	Strong communication and collaboration skills.
	Open to feedback and iterative improvement.


Experience &amp; Qualifications:


	3&ndash;5 years of experience as a Graphic Designer, Videographer, or Multimedia Creative.
	Proven portfolio demonstrating:
	Graphic design work
	Video production &amp; editing
	Experience working with marketing or product teams.
	Prior experience in technology, SaaS, or consulting is a plus.


Key Deliverables &amp; KPIs:


	Volume and quality of creative assets delivered monthly.
	Engagement metrics on visual and video content.
	Campaign creative turnaround time.
	Brand consistency across channels.
	Sales and marketing team satisfaction with creative support.


Tools You&rsquo;ll Work With:


	Adobe Creative Suite
	Video editing tools
	Figma (optional but desirable)
	Social media platforms
	Marketing automation tools (for asset deployment).


Salary
&nbsp;N200,000 - N300,000 per month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and&nbsp;portfolio to:&nbsp;recruitment@snapnetsolutions.com&nbsp;using &quot;multimedia creative designer&quot; as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-12",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-17",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Snapnet Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Multimedia Creative Designer (Graphic Design & Video) Job at Snapnet Limited




        
    

        
        Snapnet  Limited is a leading technology consulting firm and certified partner of Microsoft, AWS, Oracle, Huawei, and other global OEMs.Snapnet is an ICT Consulting firm with strategic focus in developing Industry specific solutions, Business consulting and Systems Integration with offices in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria. We are committed to delivering first class innovation, quality, and state of the art technology solutions to discerning clients both in the private and public sector.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Multimedia Creative Designer (Graphic Design & Video)

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Role Summary


	We are seeking a highly creative and execution-focused Multimedia Creative Designer who will own the visual identity, graphic assets, and video content across all our digital and physical marketing channels.
	This role is critical to driving brand visibility, lead generation, product storytelling, and sales enablement across Snapnet and its SaaS products (HCMatrix, Acumeet, Procurecentro).
	You will work closely with Digital Marketing, Content, Sales, Product, and Leadership to translate ideas, campaigns, and product features into high-impact visual and video assets.


Key Responsibilities
Graphic Design (Core Responsibility):


	Design high-quality visual assets for:
	Social media (LinkedIn, Instagram, X)
	Websites & landing pages
	Email marketing campaigns
	Blog posts, whitepapers, ebooks, and case studies
	Sales decks, proposals, pitch decks, and brochures
	Event materials (banners, roll-ups, flyers, stage visuals)
	Maintain and enforce brand consistency across all designs.
	Collaborate with the content team to visually interpret written content.
	Design creatives optimized for lead generation and conversions.
	Create infographics to simplify complex technology concepts (AI, Data, HR, SaaS).


Video Production & Editing:


	Plan, shoot, and edit videos including:
	Product demos & walkthroughs
	Explainer videos
	Short-form social videos (LinkedIn reels, teasers, clips)
	Founder/Executive thought leadership videos
	Event highlights, customer testimonials, interviews
	Edit raw footage into engaging, platform-optimized videos.
	Add motion graphics, subtitles, overlays, intros/outros.
	Optimize videos for performance across digital platforms.


Campaign & Content Support:


	Support marketing campaigns with creative assets aligned to campaign goals.
	Translate GTM themes, messaging, and value propositions into visuals.
	Work closely with:
	Digital Marketer → performance & campaign creatives
	Content Manager → blogs, ebooks, long-form content
	Sales Team → presentations, proposal visuals
	Participate in campaign planning sessions to ideate creative angles.


Brand & Visual Asset Management:


	Build and maintain a central brand asset library.
	Manage templates for recurring assets (social posts, decks, reports).
	Ensure quick turnaround times without sacrificing quality.
	Continuously improve the brand’s visual identity.


Innovation & Creative Direction:


	Stay up to date with:
	Design trends
	Video formats
	Social media creative best practices
	Proactively suggest new creative formats and content ideas.
	Experiment with AI-assisted design and video tools where appropriate.


Required Skills & Experience
Technical Skills:


	Strong proficiency in:
	Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
	Video editing tools (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Final Cut, CapCut, DaVinci Resolve)
	Solid understanding of:
	Typography
	Layout design
	Color theory
	Motion graphics basics
	Experience creating content for B2B and SaaS brands is a major advantage.


Creative & Soft Skills:


	Strong visual storytelling ability.
	Ability to convert abstract ideas into clear visuals.
	Excellent attention to detail.
	Ability to work under tight deadlines in a startup environment.
	Strong communication and collaboration skills.
	Open to feedback and iterative improvement.


Experience & Qualifications:


	3–5 years of experience as a Graphic Designer, Videographer, or Multimedia Creative.
	Proven portfolio demonstrating:
	Graphic design work
	Video production & editing
	Experience working with marketing or product teams.
	Prior experience in technology, SaaS, or consulting is a plus.


Key Deliverables & KPIs:


	Volume and quality of creative assets delivered monthly.
	Engagement metrics on visual and video content.
	Campaign creative turnaround time.
	Brand consistency across channels.
	Sales and marketing team satisfaction with creative support.


Tools You’ll Work With:


	Adobe Creative Suite
	Video editing tools
	Figma (optional but desirable)
	Social media platforms
	Marketing automation tools (for asset deployment).


Salary
 N200,000 - N300,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: recruitment@snapnetsolutions.com using "multimedia creative designer" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources (HR) / Admin Manager",
  "description": "Excel and Grace Consulting is a fast-paced business consulting organization with a track record of delivering exceptional business solutions to small and medium-scale enterprises in Nigeria, Ghana, Germany, Switzerland, Canada, etc. We are certified management consultants with the International Council of Management Consulting Institutes (CMC-Global) with over 18 years of experience. Our team of experts and consultants have authored over 20 books on business management, business structure, business operations, human resources, organizational structure, employee development, money management, and so on.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) / Admin Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
	Oversee the recruitment and selection process, ensuring the right talent is hired.
	Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues.
	Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital.
	Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization.
	Nurture a positive working environment and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance.
	Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.
	Organize training and development programs to improve employee skills and productivity.
	Maintain HR records and prepare reports as required.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field with a&nbsp;2-4 years of HR experience.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor law and HR best practices.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Proven ability to lead HR projects and initiatives.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and HRIS systems.
	Professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, etc.) is an added advantage.


Salary
N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;

Human Resources (HR) / Admin Manager Job at Excel and Grace Consulting




        
    

        
        Excel and Grace Consulting is a fast-paced business consulting organization with a track record of delivering exceptional business solutions to small and medium-scale enterprises in Nigeria, Ghana, Germany, Switzerland, Canada, etc. We are certified management consultants with the International Council of Management Consulting Institutes (CMC-Global) with over 18 years of experience. Our team of experts and consultants have authored over 20 books on business management, business structure, business operations, human resources, organizational structure, employee development, money management, and so on.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) / Admin Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
	Oversee the recruitment and selection process, ensuring the right talent is hired.
	Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues.
	Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital.
	Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization.
	Nurture a positive working environment and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance.
	Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.
	Organize training and development programs to improve employee skills and productivity.
	Maintain HR records and prepare reports as required.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field with a 2-4 years of HR experience.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor law and HR best practices.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Proven ability to lead HR projects and initiatives.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and HRIS systems.
	Professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, etc.) is an added advantage.


Salary
N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: eandg.tprecruiters@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
